16.text: Do you know this little creature?

21.text: This insect, the ant, is truly amazing.

25.text: It is a true super organism

26.text: The ant is an amazing organism that lives all over the world.

31.text: Ants live in the hottest desserts,

36.text: But they also live near you

39.text: But wherever you may find the ant, it almost always plays a very important ecological role.

47.text: ants clean the street from over 60.00 hotdogs a year.

51.text: But there importance as cleaners is not what makes them so amazing.

55.text: The ant is a social insect.

60.text: Although, individual ants may not really be that smart.

68.text: When foraging, ants use chemicals known as pheromones,

71.text: to solve complex problems, communicate and to locate foodsources.

76.text: Scientists are studying the ants' "swarm intelligence" to solve urban problems.

81.text: This allows them to create mathematical models, known as "ant colony optimisation" algorithms.

87.text: These algorithms have allowed scientists to solve so-called "travelling salesman problems".

93.text: These are problems in which the shortest route between several points,

96.text: which may represent cities or busstops,

100.text: Are you interested in the behaviours that make ants so very special?

105.text: Why don't you hop on over to our website?

110.text: and read our latest article about urban ants.
